Description: Terracotta mould for an ear of corn. Buff fabric with pink core of sandy texture with abundant fine quartz and mica inclusions.
Curator's comments: Probably cut from an amphora handle, as the mould cuts into the pink core, through the pale buff outer margins. This is not assured however as there is only limited chipping that one would expect. Imported fabric.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (E55)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (TI.15)
